DataElement.preferredName: Third Cycle Consolidation Therapy Off Treatment Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the reason a patient is not receiving cycle 3 or 4 consolidation therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Third Cycle Consolidation Therapy Off Treatment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the third cycle of consolidation therapy, chemotherapy treatments given after induction chemotherapy to further reduce the number of cancer cells, not being administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Following the second position in an ordering or series.:An event or sequence of events that constitute round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.:Chemotherapy treatments given after induction chemotherapy to further reduce the number of cancer cells.

Concepts.definition: Following the second position in an ordering or series; coming next after the second and just before the fourth in position.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
Treatment that is given after initial therapy to kill any remaining cancer cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment.

Concepts.definition: When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify a reason or event that caused a patient to be removed from a clinical protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

DataElement.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
